core_principles: Clarity over Beauty: In emergencies, readability saves lives.
Data Density: High information density without clutter using Bento grids.
Visual Hierarchy: Alerts (Red/Orange) must scream; stable data (Green/Grey) must whisper.
Dark Mode First: Reduces eye strain in 24/7 monitoring centers and improves map contrast.

general: Use the 'Bento' grid layout for the dashboard. Do not use standard column layouts.
Implement Dark Mode as the default. Light mode is optional but secondary.
Maps must be the central focus (Hero element).
Use Red for Seismic, Blue for Flood, Orange for Heat - Strict color coding.
Ensure all text on maps has a text-shadow or dark background for readability.
components: Use Shadcn UI for interactive elements (Dialogs, Selects, Tabs).
Use Recharts for data visualization (Seismic trends, River levels).
Use Leaflet (react-leaflet) for maps. Use a dark tile provider (e.g., CartoDB Dark Matter).
Use Lucide-React for icons (AlertTriangle, Waves, Thermometer, Bed, Activity).
data_visualization: Show 'Time to Impact' countdowns for predictions.
Use 'Gauge' style charts for hospital bed occupancy.
Use 'Pulse' animations on map markers for active events.

UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
